quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 13 Quiz 10
quiz.subtitle: 13.10: Complex Numbers in Polar Form
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Modulus, argument, and De Moivre's Theorem

questions.question: What is the modulus of the complex number z = 3 + 4i?
Express z = 1 + i in polar form.
When multiplying two complex numbers in polar form, what do you do with their arguments (angles)?
questions.explanation: To multiply complex numbers in polar form, you multiply the radii and add the angles.

questions.question: What is (2 cis 30°) multiplied by (3 cis 60°)?
According to De Moivre's Theorem, what is (r cis θ) squared?
questions.explanation: Raise the radius to the power and multiply the angle by the power.

questions.question: What is the argument of the complex number z = -5?
questions.explanation: On the complex plane, -5 is on the negative real axis, which corresponds to 180°.

questions.question: True or False: The complex number i has a modulus of 1.
Which quadrant is the complex number -3 - 3i located in?
questions.explanation: Both the real and imaginary parts are negative, putting it in the third quadrant.
